COPY - COPY - Insights → Asset Inventory Overview

config.text:
Instructions


This is a detailed dashboard that provides details of areas where data hygiene may be an issue, identifies data that needs to be cleaned up at source, or is worked around in Axonius.


Data Hygiene is key to ensure that your organization has the information you expect to enable you to ask accurate questions of that data

Change Log


3/8/25

Created


23/12/25

Now includes a adapter count users section
Adapters → Assets Fetched → Devices & Users

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014ca8.name: Device Adapters
69840e9de9aaae2eb4014ca8.description: All adapters and how many devices are seen per adapter.

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014ca9.name: User Adapters
69840e9de9aaae2eb4014ca9.description: All adapters and how many Users are seen per adapter.

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014caa.name: Device Baselines
69840e9de9aaae2eb4014caa.description: Create baseline queries for device categories you care about and want to validate. Baselining also helps us understand the device count.

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cae.name: Devices by No. of Adapters
69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cae.description:
The following chart shows devices that are seen by only one through to five or more adapters. 
 adapter. There is also a comparison with 30 days before.  This means one of two things.  

1: There is a coverage gap and the other adapters should be seeing/know of the device.  
2: These devices are not required within Axonius.  

POSSIBLE RESOLUTION STEPS

1: Investigate & confirm if these devices are active or stale devices.  Coverage gaps could be exposed.  
2: If stale, review the "last seen" date field.  Set on the associated adapter properties.  "
3: If they no longer exist in the source solution. Check the "Last Fetch" date and if these have not been fetched despite fetches taking place then populate the "Delete devices that have not been returned from the source in the last X hours"

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cb8.name: Users by No. of Adapters
69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cb8.description:
The following chart shows users that are seen by only one through to five or more adapters. 
 adapter. There is also a comparison with 30 days before.  This means one of two things.  

1: There is a coverage gap and the other adapters should be seeing/know of the user. 
2: These devices are not required within Axonius.  

POSSIBLE RESOLUTION STEPS

1: Investigate & confirm if these users are active or stale users.  Coverage gaps could be exposed.  
2: If stale, review the "last seen" date field.  Set on the associated adapter properties.  "
3: If they no longer exist in the source solution. Check the "Last Fetch" date and if these have not been fetched despite fetches taking place then populate the "Delete users that have not been returned from the source in the last X hours"

charts_meta.name: Not Last Seen in Last 30 Days or Last Seen Does not Exist

config.text:
Instructions


This dashboard tracks high-level progress for Data Hygiene.


It includes the ability to manually (or via an Enforcement Action) assign low-confidence devices as high-confidence devices using tags. A low confidence device that is tagged as High Confidence will be added to the High Confidence chart.


Note: Additional data hygiene dashboards also facilitate drilling into the low-confidence results.


Data Hygiene is key to ensuring that your organization has the information you expect to enable you to ask accurate questions of that data

Change Log


1/9/26

Updated with Low Confidence changes and the ability to manually add devices to High Confidence.


11/10/25

Created
Accurate Devices Count Status Tracker

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cbe.name: Licensed Device Count Tracker
69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cbe.description:
Licensing in Axonius is determined by the number of devices managed by the platform

Change the value XXXXXXXX to your organization's licensed device count. In addition, change the threshold number from 99999 to your target.

description.text: Axonius Licensed for - XXXXXX Unique Devices

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cbf.name: Estimated Target User Count
69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cbf.description:
Change the "Estimated Expected User Count - xxxxxxxx" according to your organization's estimated number. In addition, change the threshold number from 9999999 to your target.  

The number of users does NOT contribute to the license count.

config.text:
Replace Text With

Estimated Target Device Count

config.text:
Definitions of Low Confidence Breakdown


The low confidence breakdown contains reasons why a low confidence threshold has been met. The following is the definition for each of the queries that make up this.

↪

Key Fields Missing


This query ensures assets are sufficiently identified by requiring an Asset Name or Hostname AND at least one key identifier (MAC, IP, Serial, or Cloud ID). It acts as a quality gate, filtering out incomplete "ghost" devices to ensure the High Confidence view contains only reliably correlated assets.

69840e9de9aaae2eb4014cca.name: Not Last Seen in Last 30 Days or Last Seen Does not Exist

config.text:
Not Last Seen in Last 30 Days or Last Seen Does not Exist


This shows devices that have not been seen in the last 30 calandar days and therefore are considered to be no longer part of an accurate Asset Inventory.

Single Adapter with NO Normalization Reason


This query identifies assets visible only to one adapter. It isolates uncorroborated records, which are often excluded to prevent stale or manual entries from affecting high-confidence asset counts. This only includes devices that do NOT have a normalisation reason.

Fetch/First Seen <= 48 Hours


This query identifies devices visible only to one adapter within the last 48 hours. By excluding these unverified, newly detected assets, the High Confidence query removes potential noise, ensuring the final view contains only established and corroborated devices.

Single Adapter with a Normalization Reason


This query identifies uncorroborated assets flagged with specific normalization errors, such as invalid hostnames or conflicting serials. It isolates these single-source records with known data quality issues to ensure the High Confidence view remains clean and accurate.
No High Confidence TAGs Assigned
Include High Confidence Tags
